The reverse of a U: S. quarter issued in 2020 honors the National Park of American Samoa and features a pair of fruit bats.
The America the Beautiful Quarters: Program, authorized by Public Law 110-456, directs the Mint to design, mint, and issue quarter-dollar coins emblematic of a national park or other national site in each state, the District of Columbia, and the five U.S. territories.
The design of the reverse of the America: and the coin itself was issued in 2020, unrelated to any government plot or connection to COVID-19.
